titles.title: Recognizing the achievements of SUPERB (Students United with Parents and Educators to Resolve Bullying) and its founders Jeremy and Sharon Ring to address the growing problem of bullying in the Nation's schools.

Recognizing the achievements of SUPERB (Students United with Parents and Educators to Resolve Bullying) and its founders Jeremy and Sharon Ring to address the growing problem of bullying in the Nation's schools.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Education Reform.

committee.name: House Education and the Workforce
committee.subcommittee: Early Childhood, Elementary, and Secondary Education

bill.summary: Commends Students United with Parents and Educators to Resolve Bullying (SUPERB), its founders Jeremy and Sharon Ring, its curriculum, and its six-school pilot program in Broward County, Florida, which is to be staffed by graduate students from Nova Southeastern University's family therapy and conflict resolution programs.
